Project Assistant/Junior BA - (Lloyds TSB) Lloyds Banking Group June 2010  –  January 2012  (1 year 8 months) London, United Kingdom Working on Release C* Central Team - HBoS Migration within a number of work streams. 
 
*Release C is the largest and most complex stage of Integration between Lloyds & HBoS and affects every colleague & every customer. Release C is about preparing for & transferring all HBoS current & savings accounts & Commercial & UK Private Banking accounts onto the single Lloyds Banking Group IT platform. 
 
Readiness - Preparation & reporting whether the business is ready for the integration. As well as creating CRF's (Critcial Readiness Factors) 
 
PGV (PreGo Validation)(FOV) - An intense validation period in which the basic bank functions are tested to prove how successful the migration has been. The MI Reporting that is produced is presented to the Integration Board which directly affects whether the organisation is to proceed with the integration. 
 
BCO (Business Checkout) – A period which ensures all areas of the bank have been tested, highlighting issues that need fixing to allow the bank to function. 
 
IBP (Interim Business Processing) - When the integration is taking place many of the bank systems are unavailable. This work stream organises the white bagging of processes to be processed once systems become back in use.  
 
Gold Command & Control - The work stream that manage every work stream & division involved in the integration. Producing Go's & Tell's to allow each of the stages on the integration to commence. 
 
SharePoint - Creation & Management of a SharePoint site used for the collation of testing results which would further then be used to create Executive Reports. 
 
Executive Reporting - Production & creation of dashboards & reports which were delivered to the board on a regular basis. 
 
Stakeholder Management - Developing relationships with stakeholders, involving numerous weekly meetings & one to one sessions. 
 
Quality Management - QA & checking documents to ensure a constant high level of reporting/documentation for Stakeholders & Executives. Software Tester Lloyds TSB June 2008  –  September 2008  (4 months) Bristol, United Kingdom Work Experience 
 
Working on W2, which is a project creating software to off shore, recruitment admin work, which also included creating a training manual for the completed software. Work Experience NFU Mutual October 2006  –  October 2006  (1 month) Stratford Whistle stop tour of the company, being introduced to Project Management, Under Writing, Accounting and Risk. Experience Customer Business Analyst Intel Corporation October 2012  – Present (2 years 11 months) Swindon, United Kingdom Currently working as a customer business analyst in the META (Middle East, Turkey and Africa) region. Main task is to ensure that customers (distributors) have everything they need to achieve or overachieve their Intel targets. I do this via the following: 
 
-	setting and communicating targets and pricing strategies 
-	strategic demand forecasting 
-	inventory management 
-	providing roadmap and product training. 
-	understanding the mechanics of programs provided by Intel (bonus etc) to drive disti behaviour and maximise benefit 
-	communicating and co-operating with regional sales team to ensure business needs are fulfilled in each sub region 
-	conducting analysis at a customer and regional level to ensure goals are achieved 
-	understanding customer needs and Intel's operations and strategies to influence supply decisions 
-	dealing with conflicting information and managing a high-pressured environment 
-	order management (SAP expert) - managing the customer supply line to ensure customers have the right products at the right time (placing, tracking orders & resolving issues)  
-	escalating and crisply communicating customer issues with clear recommendations on actions needed 
-	communicating and representing customer strategies internally to senior managers and Intel strategies to external stakeholders Marketing and Business Development Exectutive University of Ulster and F3 Engineering Ltd (Knowledge Transfer Partnership) August 2010  –  July 2012  (2 years) United Kingdom My responsibilities included: 
 
•	Planning, implementing and evaluating the strategic marketing plan for the whole company 
•	Managing all areas of the marketing mix including development and implementation of successful marketing campaigns 
•	Liaising and networking with a range of stakeholders including customers, colleagues, suppliers and partner organisations and developing sustainable relationships 
•	Maintaining high levels of client satisfaction and servicing, including setting up a 24/7 call service and after sales protocols  
•	Creating and maintaining the client information database to ensure recording and communication with all contacts 
•	Efficient management of the company’s sales and marketing activities including the preparation of monthly sales and marketing reports for directors 
•	Developing sales by contacting potential new customers through the production and follow up of mailshots, advertising campaigns and cold calling 
•	Managing the design/production of: 
-	Marketing literature (price lists, brochures, leaflets, DVD’s etc.)  
-	On-going initiatives including email campaigns and press releases 
-	Contractual agreements (hire, lease, distributor etc.)  
•	Managing the development and updating of the company’s website and other social media (Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, LinkedIn, Blogging etc.) to assist with overall promotion of the company  
•	Scanning tender websites weekly for opportunities and assisting with the production of tender proposals on an on-going basis 
•	Continuously conducting extensive national and international market and competitor research/analysis 
•	Identifying, preparing and submitting funding applications and claims 
•	Ensuring successful registration of product trademark standards and international trading standards and regulations are considered  
•	Identifying, organising and attending trade shows, events, exhibitions and seminars European Staffing Sourcing Specialist Intel Corporation June 2008  –  May 2009  (1 year) This was an internship that I needed to complete in the third year of my degree and enabled me to obtain a Diploma in Industrial Studies. My responsibilities here 
included: 
 
Meeting hiring goals/objectives - I helped the Greater European Region team meet hiring goals and objectives in a timely manner by sourcing (finding) suitable candidates for various positions through cost efficient and effective channels and then conducting pre selection checklists on these candidates. 
 
Here I also worked closely with the Hiring Managers to find out their needs and the Staffing Consultants to ensure candidates where being scheduled for interviews. 
 
Engaging with stakeholders on a regular basis - such as Hiring Managers, Colleges and candidates in Hiring Process for example 
 
Conducting data analysis - I regularly analysed data surrounding various aspects such as departments hiring figures and through my analysis I provided 
recommendations on irregularities and how any negative results could be improved. 
 
Completing administration work – I had to carefully navigate around Intel’s systems to ensure that their systems of record where up to date Customer Business Analyst Intel Corporation October 2012  – Present (2 years 11 months) Swindon, United Kingdom Currently working as a customer business analyst in the META (Middle East, Turkey and Africa) region.
